meanings.definition: Chosen for a position before an official election takes place.
meanings.sent1: The preelected candidate was already known before the voting began.
meanings.sent2: The preelected mayor had already started planning for the city's future.
meanings.sent3: It was quite a surprise when the preelected winner turned out to be a dog!
meanings.sent4: The preelected leader's vision for the future was clear and inspiring.
meanings.sent5: The preelected official was like a superhero, ready to save the day before the election even started.

meanings.definition: To select or designate someone for a position before an official election.
meanings.sent1: The committee preelected the candidate based on their qualifications.
meanings.sent2: They preelected her as the team captain for the upcoming season.
meanings.sent3: The group decided to preelect the class clown as the school president for fun.
meanings.sent4: She preelected her best friend as the party planner for the event.
meanings.sent5: The company preelected him as the new CEO, surprising everyone with the decision.
